author: julianfoad
msg: Resolve a "case not handled in switch" warnings. No functional change.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/entries.c
(read_entries_new): Add the single missing case (doing nothing).

author: julianfoad
msg: Pass the user's LD_LIBRARY_PATH environment variable through "make
svnserveautocheck" to the "make check" that it calls. This enables, for
example, a path to the dynamically loaded KWallet or Gnome-keyring libraries
to be specified with "make svnserveautocheck" as it can with "make check".
* subversion/tests/cmdline/svnserveautocheck.sh
Insert extra directories at the beginning of the caller's LD_LIBRARY_PATH
value instead of replacing the caller's value.

author: hwright
msg: Add default clauses to a few switch statements, to make the compiler happy.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/adm_ops.c
(svn_wc__do_update_cleanup, svn_wc_delete4): Explicitly ignore statii other
than the ones we are interested in.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/copy.c
(svn_wc_copy3): Same, and fix up some indentation.

author: rhuijben
msg: Remove two entry reads from very common operation, replacing them with
database read operations.
This patch made the svn_wc_crop2() problems fixed in r39822 visible,
because it delays initializing the entry cache.
* subversion/libsvn_client/checkout.c
(svn_client__checkout_internal):
Only retrieve an entry in an error condition.
* subversion/libsvn_client/update.c
(svn_client__update_internal):
Retrieve the anchor url via the node api, instead of via its entry.

author: rhuijben
msg: When cropping to depth exclude, we don't want to delete the entry itself,
but only mark it as excluded in the parent.
Without this patch the code appeared to work correctly, but only because
the entry cache in the access baton had another view of the world than the
database.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/crop.c
(includes): Include adm_files.h
(IGNORE_LOCAL_MOD): Add svn_error_return().
(remove_for_exclude): New function.
(svn_wc_crop_tree2): Call remove_for_exclude instead of
svn_wc_remove_from_revision_control2, to keep the exclude entry.
